alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:37AM EDT until further notice by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Skowhegan. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 35,000.0 cfs, Flooding begins at campgrounds in Skowhegan. At 60,000.0 cfs, East River Road starts to flood. At 80,000.0 cfs, East River Road floods to a depth of 1 to 2 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Monday the flow was 36,067.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Monday was 36,402.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 83,470.0 cfs this evening. - Flood flow is 35,000.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
